definition: to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to run/to rush about/to be on the go
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work

sentences.english: The dog leapt over the gate into the field.
sentences.chinese: 那條狗躍過柵欄門奔向田野。

sentences.english: His smile spread out to his cars again, and he headed for the checkouts .
sentences.chinese: 他又咧開嘴笑了，趕快奔向收款臺。

sentences.english: It remains a historical mission for China to accelerate the process of urbanization, which will enable the nation to move towards moderate prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 大力推進城市化，是中國奔向小康社會的歷史重任。

sentences.english: Ty ran to his wife and tried to hug her.
sentences.chinese: Ty奔向他的妻子試圖擁抱她。

sentences.english: He ran up the embankment to the railway.
sentences.chinese: 他跑上路堤向鐵路線奔去。

sentences.english: Shanghai was to become tile economic engine-room which would send China hurtling into the new millennium.
sentences.chinese: 上海要成爲中國經濟的火車頭，帶領中國奔向新千年。

sentences.english: He rushed about doing preposterous things in an extraordinary manner.
sentences.chinese: 他奔來奔去，離奇古怪地幹下了種種荒謬的事情。

sentences.english: He rushed about doing preposterous things in an extraordinary manner.
sentences.chinese: 他奔來奔去，離奇古怪地幹下了種種荒謬的事情。

sentences.english: Four round four jiao designs let rush look like very stockily .
sentences.chinese: 四輪四角的設計讓奔奔看起來十分敦實。

sentences.english: Four round four jiao designs let rush look like very stockily .
sentences.chinese: 四輪四角的設計讓奔奔看起來十分敦實。

sentences.english: The boy bounced out of the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩突然從教室裏奔出去。

sentences.english: Even though he was quite far away, the mouse ran to the Monkey.
sentences.chinese: 雖然猴子離老鼠有一段距離，但它還是朝猴子奔去。

sentences.english: So, upon finishing her exams, she fled home, thinking everything would be just as it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 於是，她一考完試就奔回家中，自以爲一切老樣子。

sentences.english: The smartest money is usually headed to the door at just about that point.
sentences.chinese: 在這個點位上，最聰明的錢通常都已奔向大門口了。

sentences.english: And life's long night is ended, and he way Lies open onward to eternal day.
sentences.chinese: 生命的漫漫長夜已盡，大路開展，奔向永恆的白日。

sentences.english: We watched the heavy outflow of the tide.
sentences.chinese: 我們觀看了洶湧奔出的潮水。

definition: to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
